channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023070578
item.description:
Report E-2023070578

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: HARRISBURG
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO GROUND LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, this container was discovered to have been punctured at some point during the loading of the material or during transit. There was a small hole in the side of the drum roughly an inch from the top. The released material was neutralized and collecting with absorbent material. The damaged drums was placed into an overpack for disposition from shipper. The UN spec identification information was not able to be safely obtained once inside the overpack.

item.title: Report E-2023070528
item.description:
Report E-2023070528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading drum from trailer with a drum clamp forklift attachment, the drum was not lifted high enough that when the forklift driver was backing over the dockplate the bottom of the drum hit the lip of the dockplate slighting cutting it contributing to the unintentional release, Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and the drum was repaied with drum putty and placed into a recovery container.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer leaking from side and had corrosion on corrugated cardboard. DescribePack: Corrugated cardboard leaked a 2 inch corrosion mark DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item immediately put into 5 gallon hazmat drum

item.title: Report X-2023070900
item.description:
Report X-2023070900

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: BRIDGEPORT
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat skid on origin pickup trailer toppled crushing this package under weight. Undamaged packages removed - wet package segregated. DescribePack: Inner plastic bottles crushed causing leak from threaded top caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Affected packages removed from work area for further inspection and processing. Nearby packages inspected for leakage/spill.

item.title: Report E-2023070571
item.description:
Report E-2023070571

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one metal 55 gallon drum of beckosol 12-079 (un1866) had released 2 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023070622
item.description:
Report X-2023070622

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A tugger came over to QA to let us know that there was a leaking hazmat. I grabbed the red hazardous bin along with my PPE to check out the leaking hazmat. I found the Hazmat on its side with a wet bottom. Grabbed the Damaged hazmat and placed it upright in the hazardous bin. DescribePack: There is no visible damage on the bottles. I picked up the bottle one by one and turn it to the side to see where the leak came from. Both bottles were leaking from the cap. It looks like it wasn't secure on the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Brought it over and kept it upright.

item.title: Report X-2023070608
item.description:
Report X-2023070608

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet upon inspection of inner contents 6 x 1 gallon metal cans of sunnyside denatured alcohol one 1 gallon metal can was dented bent cracked and leaking allowing .25 gallons to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found facility produces for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: 1 gallon metal can was dented bent cracked and leaking from the bottom of the can DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote
